A leak was detected in the water heater gas line. This should be repaired immediately as it poses a safety concern.
Given the location of the water heater, it should be better protected from physical damage.
Water heaters in garages should be on a raised platform so that the pilots, burner or heating elements are not closer than 18 inches from the garage floor. Repairs should be undertaken.
The location of the water heater is considered unsafe. This situation should be remedied for improved safety.
The stand under the water heater does not appear to adequately support the tank safely. Rebuilding or modifying is recommended.

TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to verify the effectiveness of the temperature and pressure relief valve, discharge piping, or pan drain pipes; operate the temperature and pressure relief valve if the operation of the valve may, in the inspector’s reasonable judgment, cause damage to persons or property; or determine the efficiency or adequacy of the unit.
The whirlpool bath was inoperative at the time of the inspection. This should be investigated further and repairs undertaken, if necessary.
The location of the controls for the whirlpool bath was inappropriate. This should be repaired as is poses a safety concern.
The whirlpool bath was found to be leaking at the time of the inspection. This condition should be repaired to prevent possible structural damage.
The whirlpool bath was found to be leaking under the tub at the time of the inspection. This condition should be repaired to prevent possible structural damage.
The whirlpool bath was unusually noisy at the time of the inspection. This should be further investigated.
Access to the whirlpool motor should be provided (or its whereabouts should be verified with the current owner).
The cover for the whirlpool bath pump was missing and should be replaced (or its whereabouts should be verified with the current owner).
The cover for the whirlpool bath pump was damaged and should be repaired.

A ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) should be installed on the circuit for the whirlpool bath. A ground fault circuit interrupter offers protection from shock or electrocution. This should be repaired as is poses a safety concern.

A ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) installed on the circuit for the whirlpool bath was not operating. A ground fault circuit interrupter offers protection from shock or electrocution. This should be repaired as is poses a safety concern.
The valves for the whirlpool bath pump and distribution system were found to be in poor condition and should be repaired.
The piping for the whirlpool bath pump and distribution system were found to be in poor condition and should be repaired.
The grate(s) for the whirlpool bath were found to be damaged and should be repaired.

TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to operate any main, branch, or shut-off valves; operate or inspect sump pumps or waste ejector pumps; inspect any system that has been winterized, shut down, or otherwise secured; circulating pumps, free-standing appliances, solar water heating systems, water conditioning equipment, filter systems, water mians, private water supply systems, water wells, pressure tanks, sprinkler systems, swimming pools, or fire sprinkler systems; the inaccessible gas supply system for leaks; for sewer clean-outs; or for the presence or operation of private sewage disposal systems; determine quality, potability, or volume of the water supply; or effectiveness of back flow or anti-siphon devices; or verify the functionality of clothes washing drains or floor drains.
TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to determine the adequacy of self-draining features of circulation systems.
The dishwasher is an older unit. While replacement is not needed right away, it would be wise to budget for a new dishwasher . In the interim, a higher level of maintenance can be expected.
The dishwasher is inoperative and should be repaired or replaced.
The dishwasher is excessively noisy and may be in need of repair.
Rust was noted within the dishwasher. This condition should repaired.
The dishwasher was found to be leaking. This item should be repaired to prevent possible structural damage.
There is evidence of prior leakage in the vicinity of the dishwasher. This should be monitored.
The door seal of the dishwasher should be improved.
The dishwasher door is damaged and should be repaired.
The spring for the dishwasher door is not functioning properly and should be repaired.
Controls for the dishwasher were found to be missing. This condition should repaired.
Controls for the dishwasher were found to be damaged and should repaired.
A dishwasher spray arm appears to be defective and should be repaired.
The dishwasher soap door is in poor condition and may not be functioning as intended. This item should be repaired
The dish trays for the dishwasher were found to be in poor condition and should repaired.
The drying elements for the dishwasher were found to be in poor condition and should repaired.
The dishwasher latch is damaged and should be repaired.
The dishwasher did not drain properly upon testing. This should be investigated and repairs undertaken.
The dishwasher drain connection at the waste piping is considered marginal. This should be investigated and repairs undertaken, if necessary.
The dishwasher connection at the supply piping is considered marginal. This should be investigated and repairs undertaken, if necessary.
The dishwasher appears to have been lacking maintenance.
The dishwasher should be better secured.
The dishwasher lacks an airgap device. Air gaps are now standard equipment to assure a separation between supply and waste water. It is advised that one be installed.

The dishwasher airgap device does not appear to be properly configured. Air gaps are now standard equipment to assure a separation between supply and waste water. It is advised that this condition be investigated and repairs undertaken.

TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to operate or determine the condition of other auxiliary components of inspected items; test for microwave oven radiation leaks; inspect self-cleaning functions; test trash compactor ram pressure; or determine the adequacy of venting systems.

The food waste disposer is inoperative and should be repaired or replaced.
The food waste disposer is excessively noisy. Repairs may be necessary.
The food waste disposer has seized and should be repaired. The unit attempts to respond when the power is switched on but does not begin to operate and trips the breaker.
The exterior of the food waste disposer is damaged and should be repaired.
The food waste disposer should be better secured.
There is evidence of prior leakage in the vicinity of the food waste disposer. This should be monitored.
The splash guard for the food waste disposer is damaged and in need of repair.
The wiring leading to the food waste disposer appears to be defective. This should be repaired as soon as possible.

The range hood does not operate at all speeds. This condition should be repaired.
The range hood light is inoperative and should be repaired.
The range hood requires cleaning.
The vent piping for the range hood is damaged and should be repaired.
The range hood fan should be repaired so as to discharge to the building exterior.
The material used for the range hood venting is improper. This condition should be repaired.
A range hood is needed for the proper venting of the cooking area. An appropriately sized unit should be installed.

A burner on the electric range is inoperative and should be repaired.
A burner on the electric range is damaged and is need of repair.
An element in the oven of the electric range is inoperative and should be repaired.
An element in the oven of the electric range is damaged and is need of repair.
A control knob on the electric range is damaged and is need of repair.
The oven door of the electric range is damaged and should be repaired.
The springs for the oven door of the range require improvement.
The door latch for the electric range was not working properly and should be repaired.
The door gasket for the electric range was in poor condition and should be repaired.
The door for the electric range did seal adequately and should be repaired.
The utility drawer in the range is damaged and is in need of repair.
The electric range has been lacking maintenance somewhat.
The oven light in the range is inoperative and should be repaired.
The clock for the electric range was inoperative and should be repaired.

The thermostat for the electric range was found to be inaccurate and should be repaired. The temperature was found to be greater than a 25 degree difference of 350 degrees as measured by a detached thermometer.

A burner on the gas range is inoperative and in need of repair.
The burners on the gas range need servicing.
The pilot light for the gas range is in suspect condition.
A control knob on the gas range is damaged and should be repaired.
The oven door of the gas range is damaged and should be repaired.
The springs for the oven door of the range require improvement.

The door for the gas range did seal adequately and should be repaired.

The gas range has been lacking maintenance somewhat.
The oven light in the range is inoperative and is in need of repair.
The timer for the oven was found to be inoperative when tested. This item should be repaired.
The clock for the gas range was inoperative and should be repaired.

The thermostat for the gas range was found to be inaccurate and should be repaired. The temperature was found to be greater than a 25 degree difference of 350 degrees as measured by a detached thermometer.
The gas line connection at the gas range is not considered safe. This situation should be investigated immediately for improved safety.

infobutton.item: There does not appear to be a gas shut off in the kitchen. This situation should be investigated immediately for improved safety.

There is evidence of a gas leak in the vicinity of the gas range. This is a serious safety concern. It is recommended that the gas utility be engaged immediately. The current occupants of the home should be notified.

The door for the oven did seal adequately and should be repaired.

The oven was not securely fastened to the cabinet. This condition should be repaired.

A burner on the electric cooktop is damaged and should be repaired.
A control knob on the electric cooktop is damaged and should be repaired.

The microwave oven is an older unit. While replacement is not needed right away, it would be wise to budget for a new microwave oven. In the interim, a higher level of maintenance can be expected.
The microwave oven was inoperative on the day of the inspection. This should be investigated further and repairs undertaken, if necessary.
Components of the microwave operated but did not heat when tested. This microwave should be repaired and/or replaced.
The controls for the microwave oven are damaged and should be repaired.
A control knob for the microwave oven is damaged and should be repaired.
The microwave oven door is damaged and should be repaired.
The springs for the microwave oven door require improvement.
The microwave door did not seal properly. This condition should be repaired.
The microwave oven has been lacking maintenance somewhat.
The microwave oven light is inoperative and should be repaired.
The microwave was not securely mounted. This condition should be repaired.

The trash compactor is an older unit. While replacement is not needed right away, it would be wise to budget for a new trash compactor. In the interim, a higher level of maintenance can be expected.
The trash compactor is inoperative and should be repaired.
The trash compactor is excessively noisy and may be in need of repair.
The compactor exhibits excessive vibration when run. This condition should be repaired.
The compactor was not securely mounted to the surrounding cabinets. This condition should be repaired.
The trash compactor shows evidence of corrosion. This condition should be repaired.
The trash compactor door is damaged and should be repaired.
The trash compactor is considered unsanitary. Cleaning and servicing are recommended.
The wiring leading to the trash compactor appears to be defective. This should be repaired as soon as possible.

TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to operate or determine the condition of other auxiliary components of inspected items; test for microwave oven radiation leaks; inspect self-cleaning functions; test trash compactor ram pressure; or determine the adequacy of venting systems.
The exhaust fan is inoperative and in need of repair.
The exhaust fan is noisy and should be repaired.
The bathroom exhaust fan exhibits excessive vibration when run. This condition should be repaired.
The exhaust fan light is inoperative and should be repaired.
The bathroom exhaust fan should be repaired so as to discharge to the building exterior.
An inoperative bathroom heater was found. Repairs should be undertaken.
A damaged heater was observed and should be repaired.
Bathroom heater show evidence of corrosion. This condition should be repaired.
Bathroom heater controls are damaged and should be repaired.
The bathroom heaters are older. Their reliability may be reduced. Replacement units may be necessary over time.

As with many homes that are electrically heated, there is evidence of condensation and ventilation difficulties. This condition should be monitored and/or repaired. If this proves to be a problem, steps should be taken to better control humidity and improve air change within the house. This could be as simple as installing exhaust fans. A more sophisticated measure would be to install a heat recovery ventilator.
Unsafe electric heater wiring was observed. For safety reasons, this should be repaired promptly.

TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to operate or determine the condition of other auxiliary components of inspected items; test for microwave oven radiation leaks; inspect self-cleaning functions; test trash compactor ram pressure; or determine the adequacy of venting systems.
The whole house vacuum system is inoperative. Further investigation and/or repairs should be undertaken.
The whole house vacuum system is excessively noisy and may be in need of repair.

The suction of the whole house vacuum system is relatively low. Replacing the filter and checking for obstructions in the piping is recommended. If this does not remedy the situation, further investigation and/or repairs should be undertaken.
TREC LIMITATIONS: The inspector is not required to inspect the attachments or hoses; or verify that accessory components are present.
The garage door opener is inoperative. It should be repaired as necessary.
The garage door opener is damaged. It should be repaired as necessary.

The garage door opener did not automatically reverse under resistance to closing. There is a serious risk of injury, particularly to children, under this condition. Improvement may be as simple as adjusting the sensitivity control on the opener. This should be repaired immediately.

The electronic sensor for the garage door opener did not automatically reverse the closing of the garage door when tested. There is a serious risk of injury, particularly to children, under this condition. This should be repaired immediately.
The electronic sensor for the garage door opener was found to be installed at an improper height from the garage floor. This should be repaired as it poses a safety concern.

Components of the door bell were found to be damaged and should be repaired.
